website_summaries.verdict: Road-bike styling and a wide seat make this model popular for at-home workouts. It's most comfortable for shorter individuals, though.
pros: Ergonomic seating design with adjustable road bike saddle
LCD fitness monitor tracks speed, distance, time, and calories burned
cons: Height settings may not be comfortable for users above 5'7" tall, and maximum weight is 220 pounds

customer_reviews.title: Love my bike
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Very sturdy Provides great cardio for long periods. Uses double A battery. Using mine for years, only minor issues. Cons: Customer service not so good, needed a replacement adapter for my bike seat, sent me the base and seat instead, no way to connect to bike. Seats are okay but if you tape it down with electric tape, it become steady. Hard seat and spike pedals, cant use other pedals because the hole is limiting. Overall It did help me reach my weight losss goals and survived years of me. I got this as a replacement as years of using might have been too much for the seat and pedals
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lee Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: I'm 6'0 190lbs and feels as comfortable on this baby as I do on my $4000 ...
customer_reviews.text: I will start off by saying I'm a seasoned athlete not just a weekend warrior.I train in distance cycling and Krav Maga, however wanted to add a new tool to my workout toolbox. Those that said this bike is too small for tall people are idiots. I'm 6'0 190lbs and feels as comfortable on this baby as I do on my $4000 trek . The construction is superb and also a quiet ride. I set this up in front of a 176 hd projector and train using virtual cycling cds. After a month of riding about 5 hours a week I have ZERO COMPLAINTS. I just may get a second one for the wife.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy A.

customer_reviews.title: Best Quality for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike. It is amazing quality for what I paid. I do notice a clicking noise sometimes, but it's not loud at all. I also accidentally broke the monitor off with too much pressure. Take only about 30 minutes to put together if you know what you are doing and you aren't distracted. Less If You Are Really good with tools. The tools It came with worked so you wont have to worry about getting your own. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Stacye

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely well worth it! Great bike for the price! It was easy to assemble. The bike is easy to move and relocate. It is a little smaller than what you would use in a typical spin class but the settings and height adjustments make it feel normal when it is in use. It just has a smaller footprint, which I like. It doesn’t take up too much room in the house. The bike runs smoothly. The resistance works great. I had no issues standing while cycling either. I definitely recommend purchasing this bike if you’re looking for an inexpensive home exercise bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: SHORT PEOPLE ONLY!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'10" and this bike is not made for someone my height, you can't get full leg extension and could injure yourself. Ridiculous that they couldn't make this clear anywhere in the product listing. Don't buy unless you're short!
customer_reviews.author: William Finkel

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. There is a loud clicking noise inside where the chain is that is very annoying. I believe the chain is hitting the plastic cover that is over it. Can't watch TV or listen to music because of it. Also, the seat is incredibly uncomfortable. Other then that, the bike is very sturdy, relatively easy to assemble, and it's nice to see how many calories are being burned while peddling. Over all it's a good bike for the price. Just have to figure out how to make the seat a bit more comfortable, and get rid of the noise.
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Great Bike! Goodbye QUARANTINE 15!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bike because I needed something I could move around my apartment easily, but also get in some “easy” cardio. I live in an apt and my workouts incorporate sprints but I can’t be bothered to go downstairs in between sets to do a sprint. This bike is great and very easy to assemble. I got the magnetic one, but it’s pretty light and the wheels make it so easy to maneuver.
customer_reviews.author: Shanen Silverman

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and not safe for installation.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to assemble my exercise bike. I choose this product as amazon sold it or else I don’t have a plan to buy this brand. It has rusted screws, poor quality of the steel it got tear during fixing bottom part of seat adjustment and the pedal has some weird black particles, which scratch my thumb went into my skin during installation... I wish I shouldn’t bought this one.. what a bad day.
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The right pedal broke off after 5 months of use. After trying to contact customer service for a week they finally sent a replacement piece since it was still under warranty. After removing the entire crank that attaches to the pedal, both the ball bearings inside wear completely broken. I reached out to customer service again but they have not responded. At this point I just bought another bike from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Ankit

customer_reviews.title: Meter sucks, bike good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to start doing at home spin classes so i purchased this bike. The meter that reads calories and distance needs to be glued on to the bike because it falls off all the time. When im standing during my workout, the bike gets a little loud with the wheel. Im 5'4 124lbs so it cant be my weight. This bike is perfect for my height, my bf on the other hand cant stand while working out because he is tall and said thw back of thw bike kept lifting up and he felt like it was going to topple over. Hes 6'2 165lbs. Its a great bike for me
customer_reviews.author: Britney

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Bike arrived package well and undamaged. 2. Took about 45 mins to put together with 2 people. 3. Makes some noise when peddling but not terrible. 4. Smooth ride, easy adjustments for comfort. 5. I've done several spin class type workouts that included standing up. It went well and was a great workout. 6. Easy to change resistance while working out. 7. Definitely worth the price for my needs. Hopefully it holds up👍
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Assembly/ Delivery
customer_reviews.text: This review is on the assembly only. It was very clear and easy on how to put the bike together took me less than 2 hrs. All parts were included. There were three extra pieces(pictured) that didn’t have any instruction on where those are places. My guess maybe to make the seating for higher who knows. Also the delivery was supper fast!!! I live in Japan and I ordered July 29 by August 5 it was delivered. That was great! Will do another update after some usage and let y’all know 😁
customer_reviews.author: Rika B

customer_reviews.title: When the treadmill got to painful this has been an excellent alternative
customer_reviews.text: When the treadmill got to painful this has been an excellent alternative. I don't know why there are reviews about noise and cheap quality. I'm picky. I don't have money to throw around and shipping to Alaska in NOT cheap. I expect to get my money's worth. This is a quality wcwvecise piece for the average cycling user. I can use it every day, it's quiet. Is solid. It's stable. It's nice looking so I can leave it set up in the open without it being an eyesore. It's ergonomically comfortable. It's challenging as the setting is increased on the weighted wheel. It's simple to Put together and use.
customer_reviews.author: ifsogirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this bike for cycling classes with the peloton app and youtube spin classes. I weigh about 140 and its proved sturdy enough. I usually have to tighten some bolts in the handlebar post and around the base after classes, but that's easy enough. Highly recommend for the price if you're just starting to get into cycling/spin classes at home. Definitely sturdy enough if you intend to ride seated.
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Caused back pain
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this bike. It takes a little while to set up. Not too difficult. It's quiet when in use and offers a lot of resistance. However, I have to get rid of it because it's been causing me all sorts of back pain. There's just not enough support no matter how I position myself or adjust the seat height. I would look elsewhere or go with a recumbent bike instead.
customer_reviews.author: Rainmaker

customer_reviews.title: Price, quality. As expected.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble, since all the screws were already placed on the parts. It rides smooth and has a great pacer. The only thing I would say is that It is made for people within the 5’3” area and I am 5’1”, I have to literally hop on and off of this bike. It makes this annoying squeak around the seat area and it moves while you are riding it. It’s great for the price and it does it job, seat can be quite uncomfortable. My bike came with two random metal things and no instructions on what to do with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Andrea Tovar Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty decent for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty decent for the price. Packaging was a little bit of a pain--things were packed so tightly together and EVERYTHING was taped to everything else, so unboxing it was probably a bigger hassle than the actual assembly. The way the pedals are packed so tightly together squishes one of them so I have to use my hands to lift the plastic and get my shoe in. The instructions aren't great, but I'm a tech writer and I will find fault with everything. The little tools included for assembly are kind of worthless, especially when mounting the seat. Overall, it's a decent bike for light use for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly A

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This bike is extremely noisy, doesn't feel very sturdy even though it was assembled properly, and it is not a smooth ride at all. The monitor values seem to be arbitrary with the time as the only thing close to being accurate. After about 3 weeks the monitor would only stay on for 15 minutes, then it would go blank. The bike works for very basic purposes and you shouldn't expect much from this purchase. I have returned this item and bought a better more expensive bike.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Hailey

customer_reviews.title: I love this bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike! I am 5'5 and it fits me perfectly. The handlebars are great and the seat is really comfortable. It is wider than a spin bike at the gym but I like it better because I don't get "saddle sore". It took me about 45 minutes to put together by myself. I use this for at home spinning classes. The tension can get REALLY heavy and it is easy to adjust on the fly. I would 110% recommend this bike to anyone who is looking for a quality bike on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: HannahSmith

customer_reviews.title: A great budget bike
customer_reviews.text: If you buy this bike expecting a reliable way to exercise at home, then you won't be disappointed. I assembled it relatively quickly while my kids "helped," including a two-year-old. It's not the same quality as the more expensive bikes you would find in a gym, but it offers plenty for me when I can't get outside for a run.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Cyzewski

customer_reviews.title: This cause a shuddering and its very annoying. I can tell because the raised parts on ...
customer_reviews.text: Imagine you are road biking and keep having to ride over those raised pavement reflectors. The wheel is not perfectly round and drags at intermittent spots. This cause a shuddering and its very annoying. I can tell because the raised parts on the wheel have developed scuff marks. It would be a pain to disassemble and return. Also, as many other have complained its for short people I drilled 1 more hole in the seat bar to get it 1.25 inches higher. I am 5 10' and it is just right now.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Rob

customer_reviews.title: Won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Really liked this bike when I first received it. It was easy to assemble and while the handle bars couldn’t adjust, it was good enough for the home gym. Fast Forward not even a month later, and there is now a very loud rattling noise coming from inside the Flywheel almost as if something is loose. I would say this was user error but unfortunately the flywheel and the base are preassembled when it arrives. I will be returning this bike as the writing is on the wall that this thing will not last very long with daily use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t give this bike a 1 star because it does what I need it to do which is exercise but it is hard to be in it for a while or or try to do a few niles because the seat is very uncomfortable. It hurts my butt before doing a mile. Assembly wasn’t too bad but wasn’t great too. I like the style, it feels sturdy but I don’t recommend it because it is very uncomfortable. When u try to stand up it definitely moves so that’s scary. So I don’t recommend
customer_reviews.author: Rj Aquino

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction. Pedal broke off during use.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this bike for about 6 months. About 3 months ago, we lost the ability to adjust the intensity, and just this week, the pedal snapped completely off! The metal of the crank actually broke in two, right where it attaches to the pedal! Contacted Sunny about material defect, and they claim that we are out of warranty. Good bike if you only plan to use it for 3 months. Update: We bought a second bike to replace the broken one (Sunny Fitness was out of the replacement part) and 6 months later THE SAME PART BROKE ON OUR NEW BIKE!!!
customer_reviews.author: austin82

customer_reviews.title: Nice little bike
customer_reviews.text: Great compact little bike! Fits on about a yoga mat worth of space with no problem. Seems sturdy so far, I’ve been using it with the peloton app to do the classes and it works great (ample resistance, capable of standing and biking / doing the moves)
customer_reviews.author: Jianming Huang

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but very small.
customer_reviews.text: This is much smaller all around than any other spin bike I’ve been on. I’m only 5’4 and I’m pushing it riding this. The seat is large and comfortable, but too large for how compact the bike is, and in standing positions it seems to get in my way a little. It’s sturdy enough, although when really going fast it does wobble around some. I guess it’s fine for the cheap price though, but not great.
customer_reviews.author: amy kanuck

customer_reviews.title: Good bike. Bonus: protects the world from overpopulation
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Good quality overall, and great value. My only complaint is that even at the tallest seat position, my legs don't extend (flex) all the way down when I cycle — and I'm not especially tall (5'11''). Oh, also, not to put too fine a point on it, my family jewels go numb after spending a while (12-15 minutes) on this seat. Which may be a great thing, actually — you're buying an exercise bike with FREE built-in birth control! But seriously, take frequent breaks if you're a guy and would like to keep your junk awake / alive.
customer_reviews.author: TerryF

customer_reviews.title: Spin Baby Spin
customer_reviews.text: I dropped my gym membership since I was just going there to use the spin bike. I love that I can get my exercise while watching my favorite shows at home. It's a sturdy bike that has a smooth ride. I am seeing the other reviews saying this is not for taller people. I am 5'8 & it works for me. I have the seat adjusted to the highest level but other than that, it fits me perfectly. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Felines Rock

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bike has been great! Sturdy and great quality! I have had it for several months now and have used it daily with no issues. This is my first stationary bike but it was recommended by a couple friends who have owned several. They like this one better than more expensive ones. My husband likes it as well. Love that the seat is wide and pretty comfortable! It has an easy to use emergency stop. Great with little kids running around! I am on the heavier end of the weight limit at the moment and it feels totally sturdy. No complaints and so glad I bought this bike!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bicycle for my husband but he never used it. Then I decided to start using it. To give you an idea, I’m 5’-5” and 125 pounds, using it about 25 minutes a day at a reasonable starter pace. For one thing, the seat is super hard and uncomfortable! Then, after just one week of using it, the noise began. We took it apart and found that the insides were crumbling apart. I’ve emailed the company to try and get a replacement part. No response yet. Buyers beware!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Gaul

customer_reviews.title: It works well and was easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: What you would expect for a spinner of the price. It works well and was easy to assemble. It doesn't take up much room which is nice. It tracks how many calories you have burned and the distance you have traveled. My only complaint is really the tension settings. The bike works with a felt break pad to provide resistance. It creates friction and has a weird smell if you have the setting too tight. Overall, it has a different feel than any spinners I have used at the gym, but it was worth the money and serves its purpose for at home workout equipment.
customer_reviews.author: MLHX

customer_reviews.title: respect your equipment and it'll last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Good experience, the electronics works well nothing spectacular. Seat is comfortable. Handlebars are perfect. Don't let children/teens jump on it barefoot and mess around. The tension knob works works great as long as you make sure whoever uses it understands it's not a toy. If you crank on it like a SOB of course it's going to break something. Build with good materials for the price: installation was simple, as long as you have your own tool box it's a breeze. Nice looking equipment. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Sleek little bike!
customer_reviews.text: My husband put this bike together in like 30 min. There are two parts that don't belong anywhere, which is weird. Other than that, the bike does its job. I go pretty hardcore once I got my music going, and it feels safe and the seat is super comfortable, no need of a seat cover.
customer_reviews.author: Guitargirl

customer_reviews.title: Effective for my work out.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike for the price. I had been attending a cycle bar or exercise, decided to add to my own homework at program successfully. Not as sturdy as one of those really expensive bikes, however for the price bike is comparable. Lightweight, fits into a small space very neatly. I like the resistance, easy to adjust and use Effectively for my work out.
customer_reviews.author: tari78

customer_reviews.title: Suprisingly good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good quality for the price. I'm not seriously into spinning or anything; I was just looking for something to use to get in 30 minutes of cardio everyday. This is just what I needed. It fits in a relatively small space. Very easy assembly--all the screws/parts are bagged separately by step. That is, all of the screws/washers for Step 1 are in a baggie labeled "1", for Step 2 in a baggie labeled "2", etc. (Assemble-it-yourself furniture companies take note!). Overall, I'm happy with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: ruty2t

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. It is not expensive, easy to install ,fits in a small space , not to bulky and gets the job done . Assembly if you follow instructions can assemble it in under 60min or less.
customer_reviews.author: Sebrin.A

customer_reviews.title: pedal broke off causing injury
customer_reviews.text: bought this bike in november 2016, really did not use until march during quarantine, i used a few time. left pedal suddenly broke off!! contacted manufacturer for replacement part, they responded and keep asking for the same info ; proof of purchase which was submitted on initial complaint for. very disappointed, Amazon needs to sell the replacement parts for items they offer on website as it is too frustrating contacting manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: yvette kirkland

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This bike was a lot easier to put together than I thought. You only have to assemble the front and back base, seat, handle bars and foot pegs. I would have rated this five stars but I had to bend down the top of the back base. This could have been cause during delivery. Other than that it's a great bike for the price.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: its ok!
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay 🤷 for. I am not happy about the scratches and dent....! Its ok. But not sturdy enough for intense exercising...
customer_reviews.author: T.C Soulful

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Currently reside in an area which has high precipitation and cold temperatures therefore wanted to continue my cardio without enduring the adverse weather. Minor assembly required 15-20 mins and begin your desired routine.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended. Super stable, easy to assemble and great experience overall
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed. I read the reviews, but honestly, was a little skeptical of the overall quality of this bike just due to the great price... well, it is SOLID. Adjustable seat position for height and forward position and adj. feet makes it work on nearly any flooring. Also, this is probably the SIMPLEST piece of equipment to assemble.. finally, someone has figured out a way to organize the instructions and items needed for each step!! The nuts/bolts are pre-divided into little bags labeled with the step they are needed for.. no more searching for that #4 bolt, A1 washer and some other thing-a-ma-bobber. Nice! Overall, I would buy this bike again and again.. very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MatlockFam

customer_reviews.title: Lacks comfort...
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay bike... My complaints are that I wish it had a digital resistance level setting (it only has a knob to turn and so it is difficult to know what the resistance is) and it is not very comfy. I like the handle bars because my laptop fits perfectly and I can indulge in some trashy reality show while I bike. I really wish I bought a recumbent bike instead. This one hurts my back and shoulders after about 30 minutes. Maybe I am just not use to this type of bike and I need to strengthen my back but all I can say is ...Ouuuch!
customer_reviews.author: Kymber

customer_reviews.title: Broke after about 15 rides
customer_reviews.text: It was working great until it broke. After about 15 rides the bike started making a very loud clicking sound as well as feeling like it was stuck. Even at a slow speed with no resistance. Since it sticks it’s too dangerous to ride because you’re legs are going and the bike skips. To have someone come out and replace the chain is about the price of the bike. This is a perfect example of you get what you pay for. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CarissaSanDiego

customer_reviews.title: great value for entry level exercise bike
customer_reviews.text: With a few cheap modifications, this bike is great. The padding on the handlebars and seat is nonexistent so I added a pipe insulating foam ($1.50) The seat is very uncomfortable, can't adjust far enough back, (I'm only 5' 9") and can't be changed out, as it's bolted to a slide bar. Sunny doesn't offer a alternative seat, so I had a welder modify it and use my regular bike seat. ($35) Now it's quite comfortable. It seems well made, but I've only had it for a month.
customer_reviews.author: kevind

customer_reviews.title: Came with the wrong pieces!
customer_reviews.text: Product came with the wrong pieces to assemble. I So far, it's been 5 days I'm trying to return. It is super heavy and I am not able to take it to UPS. Lost several days of work waiting for the ground pickup. Worse buy ever. To return I will have to go downstairs and it's super super heavy. I'm super disappointed. DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.author: yaso

customer_reviews.title: Great economical Cycle
customer_reviews.text: This bike is an excellent bike for the $$. It is pretty basic with no frills and not alot of extras but it gets the job done. The frame is very sturdy and well built and it is a great bike for someone who is new to biking to intermediate.. It may not be good for those who are more expert cyclists. The fly wheel can be tightened to increase resistance. It takes a little to get used to to get the touch. I would not recommend to those who are larger framed or really obese. It is a great little bike for the all around exercise enthusiast and it is very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Arny

customer_reviews.title: Cheap cheap cheap
customer_reviews.text: This bike is terrible, seriously don’t waste your money, it’s incredibly loud, it’s not a smooth spin (if that makes sense) it’s cheap and not worth the money, we’re are returning.
customer_reviews.author: Tevy23

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Bad peddle bearings!!!
customer_reviews.text: The reason I bought this bike was because of its small size in my small apartment. I read the reviews and saw a high rating. I must be the few that got a defective bike! It sucks. The bearing where you pedal started to go bad after a few days. I went to Sunny to see about returning and it states that they will not receive the bike back without the original box. Ofcourse I threw it away because of its massive size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better for shorter people
customer_reviews.text: I like biking outside but unfortunately the weather is getting to the point where that's nearly impossible. I found this on Amazon and was excited to try it out. Overall I'm pretty happy with it. It's quiet enough for me, sturdy, and gets the job done. My complaint, however, is that it seems to be better suited for people under 5'8. I'm 5'10 and have the seat height to maximum level, and I still don't get enough leg extension to the pedals. Too much knee bending for me to bike comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it. Keep scrolling
customer_reviews.text: HATE THIS BIKE!!! It took too long to put together and then when I got to the last part of putting the wheel on it wouldn’t got on and is defected making the bike completely useless. I contacted Amazon directly on two different occasions as I was instructed to do with loss promises of follow up. So what am I suppose to do? Haul this huge bike to UPS to return it??? Sure in a perfect world that would be easy but I can’t move the thing by myself let alone getting it in the car and in a box. Awful experience and now I’m stuck with a product that doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like this bike.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t like this bike. I ended up selling it after 6 months. When I increased speed it felt like the bike couldn’t handle it.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Solid bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased over a year ago, but only started using consistently a couple months ago. I was missing a lug nut and had to run to Home Depot, but otherwise setting up went ok. I don't know if anything has changed over the last year to account for why the price dropped 40+ bucks, but it works for me at 5'9", and I can stand up on it. The monitor is pretty much only good for measuring time and distance, as you can't enter your weight or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: 2 years going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 2 years now and I use it mostly in the winter months (Oct-April here in Maine) and it has been working out great. Seems to be holding with 3-4x a week use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. JT

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in new york
customer_reviews.text: Was excited over the simplicity and price, but the sound made while cycling was disturbing and has cut my time down on my exercise routine. It destroyed my morning serenity. I used to enjoy my first 20 minutes, now I cringe at the sounds and thereby reduced my exercise time. It has encouraged me to do more free weights and old school floor exercises until I can save for a different cycle.
customer_reviews.author: kim Hommen

customer_reviews.title: Faulty assembly /Pedal problem!
customer_reviews.text: Overall I felt this bike was a somewhat satisfactory purchase, it works well, and we love using it, though at first we didn't see it, but the pedals were assembled wrong! The actual area where you have to twist in the pedals themselves, was put in the wrong way, so one pedal is the exact opposite of where it should be facing. So if you tried to make the other side work, the pedal constantly falls off and you can't put it on right.
customer_reviews.author: Olga Nechman

customer_reviews.title: What's next... moving floors for walking in place..
customer_reviews.text: For some reason, I have not lost any weight... Not sure what I need to do, I have bought the machine, assembled, and look at this thing for weeks... I may have even sat on it along the way... It definitely works and calculates the on screen info properly when the pedals move but do I honestly have to ride this thing, like as if I am trying to exercise? :) Great bike!! If you ride it, you will get results. Lots of basic features, nothing over the top. Easy to move from place to place in the same room but I would not move it from floor to floor, as in up and down steps.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Sissine

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and quiet, awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: Man this thing is definitely sturdy! The instructions for assembly aren't very easy to understand, but once you get it together - it's awesome! It's very quiet and smaller than I was expecting, which was great! It's not easy to move on carpet and it's quite heavy. But I wanted a bike I could stand and lean forward while riding it. I have no concern about it tipping. I'd buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Studdard

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: It was all I could afford but it doesn't disappoint. It doesn't have some of the fancier features but it has everything I need and it's solid as a rock. I'm 5'2" and I can just barely make it the right size for me. I have the seat maxed out. It depends on how you sit and your body shape though so I don't know how helpful that is for others.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Overall I feel like it was a waste of money and I wish ...
customer_reviews.text: This bike is very uncomfortable to sit on. I’m 5’2” if I was any shorter it wouldn’t work even on the lowest settings. The bar that leads to the handle bars losens every time I use the bike and shakes and rattles. Overall I feel like it was a waste of money and I wish I would have saved and gotten a better piece of equipment
customer_reviews.author: Tim Sevilla

customer_reviews.title: STOP READING AND BUY THIS SPIN BIKE!!!
customer_reviews.text: just finished putting mine together... Took less than 15 minutes... I am simply amazed at the quality of this bike!!! This is built just like the $1,500 spin bikes at my gym... If you are thinking of buying a spin bike for your home look no further!!! I was cautiously optimistic when ordering this bike due to the low price and I am literally SHOCKED at how fantastic it is!!! Top quality materials, the welds look great and this was a breeze to put together!!! It even comes with the tools needed to assemble it!!! Okay, really, stop reading this and put this bad boy in your cart, hit order and get to SPINNING!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ski Bums

customer_reviews.title: Great Budget Stationary Bike
customer_reviews.text: As far as a basic stationary bike goes, this one is great. It was not terribly difficult to assemble, and it the cushy seat makes the ride fairly comfortable. The computer it comes with is nothing to write home about, but it works well and serves the purpose. You can easily adjust the tension on the wheel, which is also nice. If you're looking for a budget stationary bike, this one has you covered.
customer_reviews.author: Jim K.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice bike for the price. I had to buy a cushion for the seat which is very uncomfortable. The calorie counter is also very off but if you have a fitness watch that shouldn’t be an issue
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: These are pretty great bikes
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty great bikes, it was easy to assembly and had very detailed installation instructions. It comes with all the tools you need for assembly, though I would recommend getting a ratchet to get the job done quicker. The bike itself has an electronic sensor that tells you the time/distance/speed/calories burned. The mechanical portion of the bike is great for its price, its not as nice as the ones at my gym (LA Fitness) but it still works and stays relatively quiet if youre sitting on the seat. If you get off the seat it starts to get a bit noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive low-impact cardio
customer_reviews.text: Honestly way nicer than I thought it would be for the money. Sturdy. Easy enough to assemble. The seat is terribly uncomfortable, but a cheap gel seat cover placed on top has definitely helped. Little computer it comes with is fine for tracking time and distance, but there's no correlation to the resistance you dial in. So it will tell you you've burned the same number of calories regardless of the resistance. It only picks up revolutions at the flywheel, so it doesn't know if you're riding up a mountain or pedaling on a smooth, flat street so to speak. Other than that, I really like it. Great low-impact cardio supplement on days between weights.
customer_reviews.author: wes_mantooth

customer_reviews.title: Lost weight with Consistent use
customer_reviews.text: It was very affordable, easy to put together. Ive had this bike now for 3 yrs and gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: It is an ok fit bit tacker

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Great product at great price. Must have for busy persons with sitting jobs. 15 minutes a day so far no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Demo version

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for such a well-constructed bike
customer_reviews.text: Amazing value for your money. I researched this purchase and this bike kept popping up on "best value" or mentions of being well constructed. It did not disappoint. Unless you're hardcore and have a need for a professional gym-quality spinning bike in your own home, this one will make you very happy. I'm picky about what I buy; I tend to research a lot and then usually go with the most expensive thinking it will be better or last longer. I'm glad I went with this one and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Head

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Can’t wait to start. It was just assembled. Just had two extra hollow metal pieces that I have no idea where it belongs on the bike. Does anybody know?
customer_reviews.author: Foxylady

customer_reviews.title: Bikes bearings are no good and failed within one month of mild use
customer_reviews.text: Bike failed within one month of use. Bearings in the pedal sprocket pop and grind. My 135 pound wife barely got to use it. At first we thought maybe the chain needed be broken in but later found out it was the bearings. Bad product would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this bike! Its gorgeous, well made, smooth and quiet . Took an hour to put together, very simple directions. Im about 5"9 and long legs and have it on the last setting and it's appropriate. The resistance can go from easy to difficult and get a great workout. They do reccommend oiling the chain once a month.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: OK bike but bad thread locker on pedals
customer_reviews.text: Bike was OK but whatever thread locker is being used on the pedals is junk. One of the pedals backed itself out the first time I used the bike and completely stripped the threads on the pedal shaft. I tightened the pedal down very thoroughly when I started but after 20 minutes of riding it was flopping around and now the threads are toast - I guess I'll just weld it on or use some quiksteel to hold it in now. I would recommend using some proper loctite and double checking that your pedals are really tight before you use this.
customer_reviews.author: Owen McMahan

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it... don’t waist your money
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waist your money, this bike broke after 5 months and I’m only 140 pounds... I haven’t get any response from the company about the product warranty. I contacted them and still waiting for 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Anabel Tejada

customer_reviews.title: great deal for this money
customer_reviews.text: couldn't be happier. fairly easy to put together,no issues there. set it up in front of the tv in my extra room. don't know who would need to spend thousands on a bike.
customer_reviews.author: montanna1948

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Came damaged but I was able to bend it out and use the bike. Works perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: The bike is very nice not hard to put together however this thing came ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is very nice not hard to put together however this thing came with no assembly instructions or manual I mean none! Thank God for the internet I was able to look up the instructions online but I was far from happy about that. So the four stars are for the bike. I will also add you will need to buy a seat coushion because I woke up this morning with a sore butt from riding 40 minutes last night.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. It makes a little bit of a rumble ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It makes a little bit of a rumble when I put the resistance on, but its not loud... It wobbles a little from side to side when I stand up in position 2 and 3... besides that I just hope it lasts me till next year when I can upgrade. Oh and I only had some discomfort with the seat the first day. After that it wasn't a problem for me. I stand up a lot though so maybe that's why I don't have an issue
customer_reviews.author: Brandie

customer_reviews.title: Sore behind is inevitable
customer_reviews.text: For the value, it’s a good product. Just a forewarning: the seat is VERY firm, and you can’t really use this bike in the upright position, it is more for leaning over forward. Otherwise, for the price, it’s good to have. For a quick warm up it could be great. If you need it for an extended period of time, best of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Strawberrishortcake

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike for the price
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used it about a dozen times and it seems to be holding up pretty well. It's fairly quite, but still makes a little noise. Nothing that would bother someone in another room. I have experienced a little bit if the "burning smell" that other reviewers have referenced. It comes from the wheel rubbing against the friction piece that you use to adjust the resistance. The smell hasn't been bad, but the residue from the friction pad that's left on the wheel gives me a little concern about the longevity of the bike. I will update with any changes.
customer_reviews.author: Ben B

customer_reviews.title: Well made, easy to assemble, very smooth and nearly silent operation
customer_reviews.text: This exercise bike is very sturdy and in operation is extremely smooth and nearly silent due to the belt drive and magnetic resistance features. I was impressed with the packaging of the unit as well as the easy to follow simple final assembly instructions. It features a convenient tablet/book holder and a basic digital monitor showing elapsed time, speed, distance and calories burned. Please note that this model is rated for a maximum rider weight of 220 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: M. N.

customer_reviews.title: Great exercise bike!
customer_reviews.text: This exercise bike is very sturdy, and it sits on the floor, immovable, no matter how hard I pedal. I am 5 feet tall and was able to adjust the seat to fit me perfectly. It took me about an hour to assemble it, but it was an easy job with good instructions and useful tools included.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: perfect for My Home GYM!!!
customer_reviews.text: At the moment I can say that it is sturdy and doesn't wobble while riding. The wheel runs smoothly, the resistance is adequate. Adjust-ability is great. Solid Frame and heavy, real quite, easy to assemble and easy use. Recommended!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathnep

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Great stationary bike for the price. Makes spinning convenient for me to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: good stuff, best out there for as far as home equip. goes.
customer_reviews.text: Great piece of equipment. I could put it together myself. Im 5ft 11", with most of my length in my legs. The highest setting accommodates me ok (could be better but its sufficient). Gives a good resistance, saddle comfprtable enough so far. New York winter months dont allow for going outside much, im used to running outside, so this 'antsy Nancy' wont be aggrevating her family with her cabin fever! Also use it if i missed out on the gym cause of work, just to keep up a little bit. I give it 4 stars only cause it is still just for home use. Only gym equipment is 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: dingflofbips

customer_reviews.title: Kind of awkward positioning of bike.
customer_reviews.text: This bike is very nice, but the seat is awkward, and I'm not even sure why. I may be used to the gym bikes. But, I do use it, just not as much if the seat was comfortable or the position of your body while cycling. It's just a forward kind of awkward position. Very sturdy, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: NewsLady

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Nice exercise bike. Solidly made. Nothing too fancy though. No programs to bike too. You have to manually adjust tension. The worst part is the pedals. You must wear shoes as they are metal with "Claws". I wore slippers one lazy night and the next day and weeks later my foot still feels tender. The calorie, distance and time counter may or may not be accurate as I have not even tried to check but they work well and it is a nice added feature.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: which is great for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Just received it, brand new, all pieces included! I did not need my husband to help with assembly, I set it up myself, took about 1-2 hours. The bike doesn't take up too much space, which is great for small spaces! I am about 5'9, and I feel the bike is suitable for my height. I use it for medium- expert spinning, I give it a four because when I am at position 2 (not sitting on the saddle) it makes a sound. Its not loud and can barely be heard above my loud music, but other than that the bike works great for what I need it for! I would definitely purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M.almonte

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: For the price of this bike, I’m honestly surprised! It’s very sturdy, it rides smooth and is easy to move around. My husband was able to assemble it fairly quickly and without issue. The only thing I would change is the seat, it isn’t the most comfortable. I have put a folded towel down on it and that helps, but it’d be nice if I didn’t have to.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very good bike
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good bike for the price range. I have been using this for more than 2 years now. The pedal is little awkward. It's designed to work with shoes. But, I prefer to use with just socks; didn't want to soil the carpet. So, I replaced the pedal with the cushy one to go easy on my foot. It does not make much noise. Ideal for the apartment setting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: I am pregnant and bought this to exercise during and after my pregnancy. It is very heavy duty and I like the monitor and resistance. The seat is wide but a little firm for me (at the current pregnant moment). It was actually really easy for my husband and I to set up. It looks so good that I am ok with it being in the living room, even proud of it since it looks so pro. Would recommend it to anyone looking for good quality exercise bike at an affordable price. Sure beats paying for a gym and childcare to go.
customer_reviews.author: Come on! Lets be honest...

customer_reviews.title: just as good as spinner-registered trademark bike
customer_reviews.text: love these bikes, i have 4 of them for a class in my house
customer_reviews.author: amy

customer_reviews.title: Good Basic Exercise Bike
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this a couple of days ago. It's a great bike for the price and does what it needs to do. My biggest complaint is that the seat is VERY uncomfortable, so you'll probably want to buy a gel seat cover.
customer_reviews.author: William Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Bike is great, computer is useless
customer_reviews.text: Bike was very easy to put together and has worked wonderfully so far. The problem is the computer. The directions don't tell you how to change the unit. The seller claims the unit is Mph, but there is no way as it averages 100 and the unit is K. Shouldn't be Kph either as I can't be going that fast. Included a picture showing me going 105 k
customer_reviews.author: BackyardArcher

customer_reviews.title: Good bike but OW! that seat
customer_reviews.text: Bike arrived in one (big, heavy) box. It was easy to assemble and took maybe 20-30 minutes. The complex parts eg chain, gears were already assembled. The bike is pretty smooth to ride and easy to adjust (resistance, seat, etc). But my biggest gripe is the seat. Ow! Even with a gel cover it is so uncomfortable it hurts. Even after 5 minutes. I wish you could replace the seat with a standard bucycle saddle but because of how it's mounted I don't think that's possible. If anybody knows how id be very grateful!
customer_reviews.author: CP seattle

customer_reviews.title: CAN’T ASSEMBLE-Parts don’t line up!
customer_reviews.text: Should have listened to bad reviews. Got to the second step of the assembly and the two bases of the bikes legs do not line up. Short of drilling 4 new holes in the metal, assembly is impossible. I saw the bad reviews but the rating still had enough stars to make me think I’d get a good bike for the price. Amazon is sending a replacement so we’ll see how that goes. But having to repackage and mail back this huge package is ridiculous. We’ll see how it goes...
customer_reviews.author: Lydia H.

customer_reviews.title: Bike is perfect for my knee rehabilitation
customer_reviews.text: Gel seat add-on suggestion by amazon does not fit this larger seat -one star. Bike is perfect for my knee rehabilitation. Electronics work good. If you are tracking your exercise your will need to write it down on a piece of paper. This electronic devise you cannot download the information. Directions for assemble and the way they packaged the screws is outstanding. Tool for screws included.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: cheap and functional
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is great. My fiance and I use this daily and it's a quick 10 min workout everyday. Would definitely recommend for casual cycling. It doesn't have any fancy controls, but honestly I don't think it needs any of those things. The only thing I wish it had was a book rest.
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Ann

customer_reviews.title: Hate this bike---very few people in our house can "ride" ...
customer_reviews.text: Hate this bike---very few people in our house can "ride" it. I am really short 4'11, I can't adjust it enough to make it comfortable. I get really bad back aches when I ride this. My husband is 6'0 and he can't ride either becasue he is too tall. Seat is uncomfortable--will be selling at next garage sale! Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: I. Ski

customer_reviews.title: Hello please - parts unknown
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but for the life of me I can't figure out what these two pieces are for even after double-checking the assembly instructions. Tried but it doesn't fit into the seat post where currently the seat is a bit unstable. Any suggestions? Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: E.R.S.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad bike but they need to be more forthcoming with ...
customer_reviews.text: Bike Seat adjustment is just to short. I am 5'11" with a 29" inseam and I can't even come close to getting my legs extended intoa normal ride position. You need to sell a longer seat adjuster. I cut the seat tube and had a 6" tube extension welded on to the seat mount. Another problem I had was with handlebar adjustment, there is none. I took the handle bars and cut the welds with a cutoff wheel so the bars can now rotate and be locked into position when tighten down the 4 bolts. Not a bad bike but they need to be more forthcoming with size and adjustment limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bike for shorter people
customer_reviews.text: This bike works very well for the "lazy" exercise I bought it for. 20-40 minutes at a time at a non-sprinting speed. So I haven't been stress testing it at all. The seat had a couple awkward bolts but otherwise the assembly was quite easy. The bottom of the pedals have grips to help hold your feet in place without needing to deal with the harnesses. However I am 5'4" and needed to adjust the seat fairly high to reach my full range of motion. Definitely doesn't seem to be a good bike for taller people.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

product_meta.title: Sunny Health & Fitness Indoor Exercise Stationary Bike with Digital Monitor, 22 LB Chromed Flywheel
feature_bullets: ERGONOMIC SEATING: This bike ergonomically designed for optimum comfort and ease. Comes with a padded seat that can be adjusted 4 ways.
ADJUSTABLE: Adjustable seat offers user comfort and stability (Seat inseam height Min 26 / Max 32 in). Simply twist the knob to add or remove resistance.
TRACK YOUR FITNESS: Keep track of your performance and monitor your progress. The LCD monitor tracks your time, speed, distance and calories burned.
FLYWHEEL AND DRIVE: The 22 lb flywheel offers high inertia and resistance allowing you to have precise control over your riding session. Chain drive mechanism provides a smooth and sturdy ride.
COMFORT: Rubber foam paddle handle bars extend the duration of your workout. Toe clip pedals with straps will prevent feet from slipping. Max user weight limit 220 lb.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
